Candidates.Name: administration
Description: kubernesis – a shipmaster or captain, to steer or govern
One who organizes towards God's mission
A Motivation gift • Acts 27:11, Revelations 18:17, 1 Corinthians 12:28, Titus 1:4-5

Candidates.Name: apostleship
Description: apostolous – a messenger, envoy, delegate, someone sent
One who is sent
A Ministry gift • Ephesians 4:7-12, 1 Corinthians 9:1, 12:28, Acts 1:21-22

Candidates.Name: discernment
Description: diakrisis – to distinguish, discern, judge, or appraise
One who can distinguish the ministry of the Holy Spirit from false spirits/lies
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 12:10, Hebrews 5:14, Acts 5:3-6, 16:16-18, 1 John 4:1

Candidates.Name: evangelism
Description: euaggelistes – one who brings good news
One who shares the gospel and draws seekers in
A Ministry Gift • Acts 21:8, 2 Timothy 4:5, Ephesians 4:11, Acts 8:5-12, 26-40, 21:8, Matthew 28:18-20

Candidates.Name: exhortation
Description: parakaleo – to beseech, exhort, call upon, encourage
One who champions spiritual progress
A Motivation Gift • Titus 1:9, Titus 2:11-15, 2 Timothy 4:2, Romans 12:8, Acts 11:23-24; 14:21-22; 15:32

Candidates.Name: faith
Description: pistis – confidence, certainty, trust, assurance in the object of faith
A supernatural ability to trust God or inspire trust in God
A Manifestation gift • Acts 3:1-10, Matthew 17:20, 21:21, 1 Corinthians 13:3, 1 Corinthians 12:9, Hebrews 11:1-40

Candidates.Name: giving
Description: metadidami – to impart, give sincerely, generously
One who keeps the church resourced for mission
A Motivation Gift • Romans 12:8, 13, 2 Corinthians 8:1-5, 9:6-15, Acts 4:32-37, Galatians 4:15, Philippians 4:10-18

Candidates.Name: healing
Description: charismata iamaton – gifts of healing
One who demonstrates God's powerful hand through healing
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 12:9, 28, 30; 2 Corinthians 12:7-10; James 5:13-16

Candidates.Name: interpretation
Description: hermeneia – interpret
One who translates a heavenly or earthly language to convey God’s message
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 12:10, 30; 14:26-28

Candidates.Name: knowledge
Description: gnosis – knowledge, understanding
One who provides spiritual insight
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 1:4-7, 18-31, 12:8, Romans 15:14, 2 Corinthians 2:14

Candidates.Name: leadership
Description: proistemi – to lead, assist, protect, and care for others
One who provides direction & focus on the mission
A Motivation Gift • Romans 12:8, 1 Thessalonians 5:12-13, 1 Timothy 3:4-5, 12, 5:17

Candidates.Name: mercy
Description: eleeo – to be patient and compassionate toward those who are suffering or afflicted
One who keeps us centered on God's love
A Motivation Gift • Matthew 5:7, 18:33, Ephesians 2:4-6, Romans 12:8, 15, Luke 10:30-37, James 3:17, Jude 22-23

Candidates.Name: miracles
Description: energemata dynameon – workings of power
One who demonstrates God’s powerful hand through various kinds of miracles
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 12:10, 28-29; Acts 1:8, 4:29-31, 9:35, 42; Galatians 3:5

Candidates.Name: prophecy
Description: propheteia – to deliver a divinely inspired message to others
One who can discern and declare the will of God
A Motivation, Ministry, & Manifestation Gift • Romans 12:6, 1 Corinthians 12:10, 14:1-5, 22-33, Ephesians 4:11-12, 1 Peter 4:10-11, 1 Thes 5:20-21

Candidates.Name: serving
Description: diakonia – to wait tables; antilepsis- helping
One who meets practical needs, keeps ministry moving
A Motivation Gift • Romans 12:7, 1 Corinthians 12:4-7, 28, 16:15-16, Acts 6:1-7, 20:35, 2 Timothy 4:11, Revelations 2:19

Candidates.Name: shepherding
Description: poimen – a shepherd, overseer
One who nurtures and protects the flock
A Ministry Gift • 1 Timothy 3:1-17, Titus 1:6-9, Ephesians 4:11, Jeremiah 3:15, Acts 20:28, John 10:11-18

Candidates.Name: teaching
Description: didaskalos – to teach, instruct, instill, explain, expound
One who keeps us learning and growing
A Ministry & Motivation Gift • James 3:1, Romans 12:7, Ephesians 4:11, 1 Corinthians 12:28, 1 Timothy 3:15

Candidates.Name: tongues
Description: glosso – a tongue, a language
A supernatural ability to communicate in another or heavenly language
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 12 & 14; Acts 2:4, 19:6

Candidates.Name: wisdom
Description: sophia – the intimate knowledge and understanding of God's Word which leads to holy living
One who champions holy living
A Manifestation Gift • 1 Corinthians 1:17-31, 2:1-16, 12:8, Psalm 111:10, Colossians 1:9-10, 2:1-3, James 3:13-18

Statements.Text: I'm energized by organizing people to accomplish many different tasks and objectives.
I like to venture out and start new projects.
I can easily determine whether a statement is true to Scripture or not.
I can clearly communicate the Gospel to others.
I believe everyone needs encouragement in this life, and I love to give it.
I live confidently knowing that God is intimately concerned and involved with my life.
I live a simple lifestyle so that I can give a large portion of my income to God's work.
People ask me my perspective or interpretation of specific passages of Scripture.
I have been told that I am a leader.
I have great empathy for those who are facing difficult life challenges.
I am very protective of the spiritual well-being of others.
God sometimes gives me an image, word, or message to share with someone.
I enjoy doing everyday tasks that support the various ministries of the church.
I spend extended time studying the Bible knowing that my efforts will benefit someone else.
I have helpful insights into situations that have not been made clear to others.
I have supernatural eyes to see what needs to be done and implement a plan to make it happen.
I am willing to take risks for the kingdom of God that others may not.
I pay attention to what people say and how they say it, particularly those who teach.
I feel a burden of compassion for those who are lost without Jesus.
When people are discouraged, I remind them of the power and promises of God found in Scripture.
I trust God completely to answer my prayers according to His perfect will.
I joyfully give of my income - often more than a tithe.
The Spirit has brought to mind information that I have used to minister to others effectively.
I have a vision for my ministry/community and I know what needs to be done to accomplish it.
I see the sick or needy as those who most need the love and comfort that Jesus offers.
I love spending time nurturing and guiding others in their faith.
I have sometimes received a revelation from the Lord and spoken it to a person or group.
I readily volunteer to help in church when I know it will fill a practical need.
I effectively communicate the Bible in ways that influence and motivate others to learn more.
I have learned from my life experiences and can guide others who are facing similar challenges.
I naturally serve others by delegating responsibility to them and trusting them.
I can minister to people in different cultures effectively.
I am a quick and accurate judge of character.
I build relationships with non-Christians so that God will use me to share the gospel with them.
I am compelled to challenge and inspire growth in those whose faith is stagnant.
I know God will come through even if I don't see any possible solution to my problem.
Giving brings me great joy because I know this will serve others and extend the kingdom.
I study the Bible in order to share truth with others in and outside the church.
I am not afraid to take risks to advance the kingdom of God through my church or ministry.
I care deeply about those who are hurting and want to help them navigate through tough times.
I desire to help the wounded and lost find healing and shelter in Jesus Christ.
The Lord has spontaneously given me information to share with someone so they can experience God's love or guidance.
I like to be in the background and have no need of recognition for my service in the church.
I am able to explain deep theological truths in ways that even a child can understand them.
I help people by offering Scriptural principles as solutions to life's various challenges.
I love to serve the church by helping it run more efficiently.
God has given me influence over several different ministries and/or churches.
I can readily sense the enemy or a demonic influence in a situation.
I love to memorize Scripture to share with those who don't know Jesus as their Savior.
I am not afraid to challenge someone if I know it will foster spiritual growth in their life.
I will boldly move forward in a situation if I sense God's calling and provision to do so.
I have been blessed financially so I can be a blessing to the church and her mission to reach the lost and help the poor.
I retain most of what I learn and can recall it quickly when the need arises.
I can readily identify leaders and love to help them grow in their gifts and abilities.
I love to see people through the storms of life and show them the compassion that Jesus did.
I care about the church and do all I can to see it grow and be built up in love.
God sometimes lay a particular person or matter on my mind to intercede for.
I set aside time in my week to help those in need in my church and community.
I hate it when someone uses Scripture out of context for their own purposes.
I can see where a person’s decisions will lead them, and can offer godly guidance.
I have often felt moved to pray for those who are sick and to boldly pray for their healing.
I believe God still performs miracles today. What God did in the Scriptures, He still does.
I have at times spoken in an unknown language while in prayer or worship.
I have heard someone else speaking in a unknown language, and have been able to translate.
I have laid hands on a sick person and seen God heal them through me.
I have prayed for God to intervene in a miraculous way and have witnessed Him answer this prayer miraculously.
The Spirit sometimes empowers me to speak in a language that is unknown to me.
The Spirit sometimes enables me to translate what another person is saying, even if no one else is able to translate.
I have prayed in a group for someone to be healed and have seen full or partial healing.
I believe Jesus’ promise that if we have faith we can say to a mountain, 'be thrown into the sea.'
While in prayer or worship, I will sometimes break into a spontaneous prayer language.
I feel comfortable around people speaking in tongues, and often pray that God will help me interpret tongues for the benefit of the community.
I deeply believe God heals people and continues to demonstrate His love through healing.
I have witnessed God perform miracles through me or through other people.
I sometimes sense the Spirit communicating through me, and when I open my mouth the message is delivered in another language.
I have interpreted another person's prayer or message to the benefit of the audience/listener.
I serve the church in the places I see the most need and am most passionate to meet that need.
I seek to meet practical, spiritual, or emotional needs in the church.
I long to see the Kingdom of God advance and the Body of Christ grow to full maturity.
I work to build up the Body through strategic initiatives caring for those inside and outside of the church.
I love to reveal God to others through a supernatural revelation of His voice, mind, or hand.
I believe that God still moves today in signs, wonders, miracles, and prophecy.
